result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary A Kiefer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Apply 3 days sentence credit, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied.  PAID IN FULL.  Balance of cash bail to be refunded to poster.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Defendant to contact Probation by 09:00 a.m. on 08-11-2016.

Cases 15CM1939 and 15CM1956 were dismissed and read in.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all standard release conditions.
STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachary A Kiefer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Grant Scaife appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Zachary A Kiefer in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.


Court orders the following:
SENTENCE WITHHELD.
3 Days Credit - IF REVOKED.

Term of Probation:  8 Months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
Defendant to contact probation by 9 am tomorrow (08/11/16).

Costs:  $243
Apply Bail and Refund Balance to the Posting Party.

CONDITION TIME:
20 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
STAYED - To be used at the agents discretion.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.
